trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Users
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Users

trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Users
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Users

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines the operations that can be used on a DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines the operations that can be used on a DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: A user is a logical namespace for scoping permissions on collections, documents, attachment, stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions.
trans-unit.target: A user is a logical namespace for scoping permissions on collections, documents, attachment, stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions.

trans-unit.source: The user construct lives under a database resource and thus cannot cross the database boundary it is under.
trans-unit.target: The user construct lives under a database resource and thus cannot cross the database boundary it is under.

trans-unit.source: The user resource is represented by <legacyBold><legacyItalic>users</legacyItalic></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB REST resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The user resource is represented by <legacyBold><legacyItalic>users</legacyItalic></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB REST resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: It is a system resource, and thus contains a fixed schema.
trans-unit.target: It is a system resource, and thus contains a fixed schema.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows an example JSON representation for a user:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows an example JSON representation for a user:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required.</legacyBold> This is the only user settable property.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required.</legacyBold> This is the only user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is a unique name that identifies a user, i.e. no two users share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> within a database.
trans-unit.target: It is a unique name that identifies a user, i.e. no two users share the same <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> within a database.

trans-unit.source: The name must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The name must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the user resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the user resource.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property representing the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property representing the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: _permissions
trans-unit.target: _permissions

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property denoting the addressable path of the feed of permissions resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property denoting the addressable path of the feed of permissions resource.
